00034  * lustre/utils/create_iam.c
00035  *
00036  * User-level tool for creation of iam files.
00037  *
00038  * Author: Wang Di <wangdi@clusterfs.com>
00039  * Author: Nikita Danilov <nikita@clusterfs.com>
00040  */
00041 
00042 #include <unistd.h>
00043 #include <stdlib.h>
00044 #include <stdio.h>
00045 #include <fcntl.h>
00046 #include <string.h>
00047 #include <errno.h>
00048 
00049 #include <sys/types.h>
00050 
00051 #ifdef HAVE_ENDIAN_H
00052 #include <endian.h>
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 void usage(void)
00056 {
00057         printf("usage: create_iam "
00058                "[-h] [-k <keysize>] [-r recsize] [-b <blocksize] [-p <ptrsize>] [-v]\n");
00059 }
00060 
00061 enum {
00062         IAM_LFIX_ROOT_MAGIC = 0xbedabb1edULL,
00063         IAM_LVAR_ROOT_MAGIC = 0xb01dface
00064 };
00065 
00066 struct iam_lfix_root {
00067         u_int64_t  ilr_magic;
00068         u_int16_t  ilr_keysize;
00069         u_int16_t  ilr_recsize;
00070         u_int16_t  ilr_ptrsize;
00071         u_int16_t  ilr_indirect_levels;
00072 };
00073 
00074 enum {
00075         IAM_LEAF_HEADER_MAGIC = 0x1976,
00076         IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC   = 0x1973
00077 };
00078 
00079 struct iam_leaf_head {
00080         u_int16_t ill_magic;
00081         u_int16_t ill_count;
00082 };
00083 
00084 struct dx_countlimit {
00085         u_int16_t limit;
00086         u_int16_t count;
00087 };
00088 
00089 typedef __u32 lvar_hash_t;
00090 
00091 struct lvar_leaf_header {
00092         u_int16_t vlh_magic; /* magic number IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC */
00093         u_int16_t vlh_used;  /* used bytes, including header */
00094 };
00095 
00096 struct lvar_root {
00097         u_int32_t vr_magic;
00098         u_int16_t vr_recsize;
00099         u_int16_t vr_ptrsize;
00100         u_int8_t  vr_indirect_levels;
00101         u_int8_t  vr_padding0;
00102         u_int16_t vr_padding1;
00103 };
00104 
00105 struct lvar_leaf_entry {
00106         u_int32_t vle_hash;
00107         u_int16_t vle_keysize;
00108         u_int8_t  vle_key[0];
00109 };
00110 
00111 enum {
00112         LVAR_PAD   = 4,
00113         LVAR_ROUND = LVAR_PAD - 1
00114 };
00115 
00121 #define STORE_UNALIGNED(val, dst)                       \
00122 ({                                                      \
00123         typeof(val) __val = (val);                      \
00124                                                         \
00125         CLASSERT(sizeof(val) == sizeof(*(dst)));        \
00126         memcpy(dst, &__val, sizeof(*(dst)));            \
00127 })
00128 
00129 static void lfix_root(void *buf,
00130                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00131 {
00132         struct iam_lfix_root *root;
00133         struct dx_countlimit *limit;
00134         void                 *entry;
00135 
00136         root = buf;
00137         *root = (typeof(*root)) {
00138                 .ilr_magic           = cpu_to_le64(IAM_LFIX_ROOT_MAGIC),
00139                 .ilr_keysize         = cpu_to_le16(keysize),
00140                 .ilr_recsize         = cpu_to_le16(recsize),
00141                 .ilr_ptrsize         = cpu_to_le16(ptrsize),
00142                 .ilr_indirect_levels = 0
00143         };
00144 
00145         limit = (void *)(root + 1);
00146         *limit = (typeof(*limit)){
00147                 /*
00148                  * limit itself + one pointer to the leaf.
00149                  */
00150                 .count = cpu_to_le16(2),
00151                 .limit = (blocksize - sizeof *root) / (keysize + ptrsize)
00152         };
00153 
00154         entry = root + 1;
00155         /*
00156          * Skip over @limit.
00157          */
00158         entry += keysize + ptrsize;
00159 
00160         /*
00161          * Entry format is <key> followed by <ptr>. In the minimal tree
00162          * consisting of a root and single node, <key> is a minimal possible
00163          * key.
00164          *
00165          * XXX: this key is hard-coded to be a sequence of 0's.
00166          */
00167         entry += keysize;
00168         /* now @entry points to <ptr> */
00169         if (ptrsize == 4)
00170                 STORE_UNALIGNED(cpu_to_le32(1), (u_int32_t *)entry);
00171         else
00172                 STORE_UNALIGNED(cpu_to_le64(1), (u_int64_t *)entry);
00173 }
00174 
00175 static void lfix_leaf(void *buf,
00176                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00177 {
00178         struct iam_leaf_head *head;
00179 
00180         /* form leaf */
00181         head = buf;
00182         *head = (struct iam_leaf_head) {
00183                 .ill_magic = cpu_to_le16(IAM_LEAF_HEADER_MAGIC),
00184                 /*
00185                  * Leaf contains an entry with the smallest possible key
00186                  * (created by zeroing).
00187                  */
00188                 .ill_count = cpu_to_le16(1),
00189         };
00190 }
00191 
00192 static void lvar_root(void *buf,
00193                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00194 {
00195         struct lvar_root *root;
00196         struct dx_countlimit *limit;
00197         void                 *entry;
00198         int isize;
00199 
00200         isize = sizeof(lvar_hash_t) + ptrsize;
00201         root = buf;
00202         *root = (typeof(*root)) {
00203                 .vr_magic            = cpu_to_le32(IAM_LVAR_ROOT_MAGIC),
00204                 .vr_recsize          = cpu_to_le16(recsize),
00205                 .vr_ptrsize          = cpu_to_le16(ptrsize),
00206                 .vr_indirect_levels  = 0
00207         };
00208 
00209         limit = (void *)(root + 1);
00210         *limit = (typeof(*limit)){
00211                 /*
00212                  * limit itself + one pointer to the leaf.
00213                  */
00214                 .count = cpu_to_le16(2),
00215                 .limit = (blocksize - sizeof *root) / isize
00216         };
00217 
00218         entry = root + 1;
00219         /*
00220          * Skip over @limit.
00221          */
00222         entry += isize;
00223 
00224         /*
00225          * Entry format is <key> followed by <ptr>. In the minimal tree
00226          * consisting of a root and single node, <key> is a minimal possible
00227          * key.
00228          *
00229          * XXX: this key is hard-coded to be a sequence of 0's.
00230          */
00231         entry += sizeof(lvar_hash_t);
00232         /* now @entry points to <ptr> */
00233         if (ptrsize == 4)
00234                 STORE_UNALIGNED(cpu_to_le32(1), (u_int32_t *)entry);
00235         else
00236                 STORE_UNALIGNED(cpu_to_le64(1), (u_int64_t *)entry);
00237 }
00238 
00239 static int lvar_esize(int namelen, int recsize)
00240 {
00241         return (offsetof(struct lvar_leaf_entry, vle_key) +
00242                 namelen + recsize + LVAR_ROUND) & ~LVAR_ROUND;
00243 }
00244 
00245 static void lvar_leaf(void *buf,
00246                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00247 {
00248         struct lvar_leaf_header *head;
00249 
00250         /* form leaf */
00251         head = buf;
00252         *head = (typeof(*head)) {
00253                 .vlh_magic = cpu_to_le16(IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC),
00254                 .vlh_used  = cpu_to_le16(sizeof *head + lvar_esize(0, recsize))
00255         };
00256 }
00257 
00258 enum iam_fmt_t {
00259         FMT_LFIX,
00260         FMT_LVAR
00261 };
00262 
00263 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00264 {
00265         int rc;
00266         int opt;
00267         int blocksize = 4096;
00268         int keysize   = 8;
00269         int recsize   = 8;
00270         int ptrsize   = 4;
00271         int verbose   = 0;
00272         void *buf;
00273         char *fmtstr = "lfix";
00274         enum iam_fmt_t fmt;
00275 
00276         do {
00277                 opt = getopt(argc, argv, "hb:k:r:p:vf:");
00278                 switch (opt) {
00279                 case 'v':
00280                         verbose++;
00281                 case -1:
00282                         break;
00283                 case 'b':
00284                         blocksize = atoi(optarg);
00285                         break;
00286                 case 'k':
00287                         keysize = atoi(optarg);
00288                         break;
00289                 case 'r':
00290                         recsize = atoi(optarg);
00291                         break;
00292                 case 'p':
00293                         ptrsize = atoi(optarg);
00294                         break;
00295                 case 'f':
00296                         fmtstr = optarg;
00297                         break;
00298                 case '?':
00299                 default:
00300                         fprintf(stderr, "Unable to parse options.");
00301                 case 'h':
00302                         usage();
00303                         return 0;
00304                 }
00305         } while (opt != -1);
00306 
00307         if (ptrsize != 4 && ptrsize != 8) {
00308                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid ptrsize (%i). "
00309                         "Only 4 and 8 are supported\n", ptrsize);
00310                 return 1;
00311         }
00312 
00313         if (blocksize <= 100 || keysize < 1 || recsize < 0) {
00314                 fprintf(stderr, "Too small record, key or block block\n");
00315                 return 1;
00316         }
00317 
00318         if (keysize + recsize + sizeof(struct iam_leaf_head) > blocksize / 3) {
00319                 fprintf(stderr, "Too large (record, key) or too small block\n");
00320                 return 1;
00321         }
00322 
00323         if (!strcmp(fmtstr, "lfix"))
00324                 fmt = FMT_LFIX;
00325         else if (!strcmp(fmtstr, "lvar"))
00326                 fmt = FMT_LVAR;
00327         else {
00328                 fprintf(stderr, "Wrong format `%s'\n", fmtstr);
00329                 return 1;
00330         }
00331 
00332         if (verbose > 0) {
00333                 fprintf(stderr,
00334                         "fmt: %s, key: %i, rec: %i, ptr: %i, block: %i\n",
00335                         fmtstr, keysize, recsize, ptrsize, blocksize);
00336         }
00337         buf = malloc(blocksize);
00338         if (buf == NULL) {
00339                 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to allocate %i bytes\n", blocksize);
00340                 return 1;
00341         }
00342 
00343         memset(buf, 0, blocksize);
00344 
00345         if (fmt == FMT_LFIX)
00346                 lfix_root(buf, blocksize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
00347         else
00348                 lvar_root(buf, blocksize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
00349 
00350         rc = write(1, buf, blocksize);
00351         if (rc != blocksize) {
00352                 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to write root node: %m (%i)\n", rc);
00353                 free(buf);
00354                 return 1;
00355         }
00356 
00357         /* form leaf */
00358         memset(buf, 0, blocksize);
00359 
00360         if (fmt == FMT_LFIX)
00361                 lfix_leaf(buf, blocksize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
00362         else
00363                 lvar_leaf(buf, blocksize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
00364 
00365         rc = write(1, buf, blocksize);
00366         free(buf);
00367         if (rc != blocksize) {
00368                 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to write leaf node: %m (%i)\n", rc);
00369                 return 1;
00370         }
00371         if (verbose > 0)
00372                 fprintf(stderr, "Don't forget to umount/mount "
00373                         "before accessing iam from the kernel!\n");
00374         return 0;
00375 }
